metadata.title: CVE-2016-7031 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The RGW code in Ceph before 10.0.1, when authenticated-read ACL is appliedto a bucket, allows remote attackers to list the bucket contents via a URL.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7031` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ceph - 0.80.11-0ubuntu1.14.04.3
ceph-common - 0.80.11-0ubuntu1.14.04.3
ceph-fs-common - 0.80.11-0ubuntu1.14.04.3
ceph-fuse - 0.80.11-0ubuntu1.14.04.3
ceph-mds - 0.80.11-0ubuntu1.14.04.3
ceph-resource-agents - 0.80.11-0ubuntu1.14.04.3
ceph-test - 0.80.11-0ubuntu1.14.04.3
libcephfs-java - 0.80.11-0ubuntu1.14.04.3
libcephfs-jni - 0.80.11-0ubuntu1.14.04.3
libcephfs1 - 0.80.11-0ubuntu1.14.04.3
librados2 - 0.80.11-0ubuntu1.14.04.3
librbd1 - 0.80.11-0ubuntu1.14.04.3
python-ceph - 0.80.11-0ubuntu1.14.04.3
radosgw - 0.80.11-0ubuntu1.14.04.3
rbd-fuse - 0.80.11-0ubuntu1.14.04.3
rest-bench - 0.80.11-0ubuntu1.14.04.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ceph package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.80.11-0ubuntu1.14.04.3').
